greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) is the numerator of the fractional part of sigma(n)/n, where sigma(n) is the sum of the divisors of n.
comment: a(n) = 0 when n is a multiply-perfect number (A007691).
a(n) = 1 when n is a prime or if n belongs to A215012.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..65537
example: The sum of divisors of 4 is 7; its abundancy is 7/4 = 1 + 3/4 so a(4) = 3.
mathematica: f[n_] := Numerator[FractionalPart[DivisorSigma[1, n]/n]]; Array[f, 81] (* _Robert G. Wilson v_, Nov 24 2016 *)
results.author: _Michel Marcus_, May 10 2016
